intro: Stenotropis berteroi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, velvety leaves and clusters of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often with a compact rosette structure. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
